140.res: The spice trade developed throughout the Indian subcontinent and the Middle East by at earliest 2000 BCE with cinnamon and black pepper, and in East Asia with herbs and pepper. The Egyptians used herbs for mummification and their demand for exotic spices and herbs helped stimulate world trade. The word spice comes from the Old French word "espice", which became "epice", and which came from the Latin root spec, the noun referring to "appearance, sort, kind": species has the same root.
